intro: Dipterygia closii, commonly known as the close's dipterygia, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves and produces yellowish flowers arranged in racemes. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Dipterygia closii is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardy nature and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
